body: Ah, I mean the actual underlying numbers are still going to be valuable in understanding the values. I agree that the usage of raw values is not something that one should use enums, but mentally, non matching enum values still add a lot of overhead. Imagine one person looking at the serialized model and see “ah this device is device value 1” and then she will get confused what 1 means - in today’s pytorch and Caffe2 impl it is gpu, and in this case it is cpu. This adds overhead in mentally understanding the behavior.
